results.title: Clair de Terre = Earth Light
results.brief_description:
Pierre lives alone with his father in Le Marais district of Paris. He constantly thinks of Tunisia where his mother died when he was only five years old. He finally manages to travel accross to the country of his birth and meets Madame Lariviere, a former friend of the family.

Credits: Director, Guy Gilles ; writers, Guy Gilles ; photography, Guy Gilles, Philippe Rousselot ; music, Jean-Pierre Stora.
Cast: Edwige Feuillere, Annie Girardot, Patrick Jouanne, Roger Hanin, Micheline Presle, Elina Labourdette.

results.title: Civil War and reconstruction: 1861-1877
results.creator_credit: Alvin Yudkoff, Milton Meltzer and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Shows the election of Abraham Lincoln, the establishment of the Confederacy, Civil War, and the problems of reconstruction. Includes the role of African Americans in the Civil War after the emancipation proclamation and the terror in the South following the war. Also includes education of African Americans and activities of the Ku Klux Klan.

results.title: City scene
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, Gordon Burwash, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: No matter where you go in the world, it is in the city square that you see the character and culture of a people. Filmed in Montreal, Athens, and Bangkok, this film makes interesting comparisons of life at the core of three great cities. Photography by Paul Leach.

results.title: City out of time
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A portrait of Venice that expores the rich legacy of art bequeathed to all. Two hundred years ago Canaletto caught its elusive beauty, and in this film details of his pictures rise before you - spired churches and turreted palaces soar into a blue Mediterranean sky. Narrated by William Shatner. (Award: Vancouver)

results.title: City limits
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Forthright, critical analysis of the problems of North American cities by Jane Jacobs, authority and author of books and articles on the subject. A former New Yorker, she chose to live in Toronto because “it is a city that still has options…it hasn’t made so many mistakes that it’s bound to go downhill.” Her remarks, and what this film shows, will interest all civic and community groups - in fact, all urban dwellers. Photography by Jacques Fogel, Albert Kish, Cameron Gaul, Raymond Dumas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurence Hyde, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Citizen Harold
results.creator_credit: Hugh Foulds, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated satire about one man’s attempt to bring changes in his community through participation with fellow citizens and the local government. A discussion starter with a dual ending, for groups exploring methods of bringing about change. (Awards: New York, Melbourne, Columbus.)

results.creator_credit: Jack Scholl, Gordon Hollingshead and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: Circle circus (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Katharine Cornwell, Bruce Cornwell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Several geometric attributes of the circle are suggested by constructing circles with computer animation. Without narration. Suitable for mathematics and art students.

results.title: Circles of learning
results.creator_credit: Patricia Roy, David W. Johnson, Roger Johnson and University of Minnesota
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction to co-operative learning strategies in the primary and postprimary school. Shows an across-the-curriculum approach that develops the co-operative learning skills children need to work in small groups. Though set in the US context, it has applicability to the local classroom situation. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level students.
